com.pump.swing

Class BasicConsole

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
            • javax.swing.JTextArea
              • com.pump.swing.BasicConsole
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable

    public class BasicConsole
extends javax.swing.JTextArea
    A modest JTextArea that appends text from thread-safe PrintStreams, and helps format tab-separated tables.

    Here is a screenshot illustrating the expected usage of this class:

    See Also:
    Text: Managing a Console in Swing, ConsoleLogger, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicConsole

        public BasicConsole(boolean reassignSystemOutputStream,
                    boolean resizeTabSpacing)
        Parameters:
        reassignSystemOutputStream - if true then System.out and System.err will be reassigned. Note this may cause security-related exceptions in some environments. Instead: if you have control of the output you're looking for consider using createPrintStream() to create a customized PrintStream to direct your data towards and not interact with System.out.
        resizeTabSpacing - if true then this component will change the tab-spacing to display tab-separated columns in a table.

      • BasicConsole

        public BasicConsole(BasicConsole.DefaultPrintStream behavior,
                    boolean resizeTabSpacing)

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static BasicConsole create(java.lang.String frameTitle,
                                  boolean reassignSystemOutputStream,
                                  boolean resizeTabSpacing,
                                  boolean exitOnClose)
        Create and display a BasicConsole in a JScrollPane in a new JFrame that is set to EXIT_ON_CLOSE.

        If called outside the EDT: this method will block until the EDT has a chance to set everything up.

        Parameters:
        reassignSystemOutputStream - if true then System.out and System.err will be reassigned. Note this may cause security-related exceptions in some environments. Instead: if you have control of the output you're looking for consider using createPrintStream() to create a customized PrintStream to direct your data towards and not interact with System.out.
        resizeTabSpacing - if true then this component is going to contain table-like data. If false then the tab spacing is unchanged.
        exitOnClose - if true then the JFrame that displays this BasicConsole is set to EXIT_ON_CLOSE. This is intended for apps where this is the only UI. For apps where this is only an auxiliary part of the UI, this argument needs to be false.
        Returns:
        a new BasicConsole.

      • createPrintStream

        public java.io.PrintStream createPrintStream(boolean applyErrHighlighter)
        Create a new PrintStrem that appends text to this BasicConsole. This method and the PrintStream it returns are thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        applyErrHighlighter - if true then text printed to this stream will be highlighted with a translucent red. If false then the text will come in undecorated.
        Returns:
        a PrintStream that appends data to this BasicConsole.

      • createPrintStream

        public java.io.PrintStream createPrintStream(boolean applyErrHighlighter,
                                             java.io.PrintStream delegatePrintStream)
        Create a new PrintStrem that appends text to this BasicConsole. This method and the PrintStream it returns are thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        applyErrHighlighter - if true then text printed to this stream will be highlighted with a translucent red. If false then the text will come in undecorated.
        delegatePrintStream - a PrintStream that also receives all incoming stream data. This lets you layer a PrintStream on top of the default System.out if you are running from a dev environment like Eclipse.
        Returns:
        a PrintStream that appends data to this BasicConsole.

      • createPrintStream

        public java.io.PrintStream createPrintStream(java.awt.Color highlighterColor)
        Create a new PrintStrem that appends text to this BasicConsole. This method and the PrintStream it returns are thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        highlighterColor - the optional highlighter color this PrintStream uses. This color should include some opacity so it combines with (and does not obscure) the default text selection highlight. (So instead of making a soft opaque red, you should make a bright red that is translucent.)
        Returns:
        a PrintStream that appends data to this BasicConsole.

      • createPrintStream

        public java.io.PrintStream createPrintStream(java.awt.Color highlighterColor,
                                             java.io.PrintStream delegatePrintStream)
        Create a new PrintStrem that appends text to this BasicConsole. This method and the PrintStream it returns are thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        highlighterColor - the optional highlighter color this PrintStream uses. This color should include some opacity so it combines with (and does not obscure) the default text selection highlight. (So instead of making a soft opaque red, you should make a bright red that is translucent.)
        delegatePrintStream - a PrintStream that also receives all incoming stream data. This lets you layer a PrintStream on top of the default System.out if you are running from a dev environment like Eclipse.
        Returns:
        a PrintStream that appends data to this BasicConsole.

      • append

        public void append(java.lang.String s,
                   java.awt.Color highlight)
        This is the only recommended way to add text to this component. TODO: change the BasicConsole so it inherits from JComponent and not JTextArea. Make it impossible to accidentally access text data through alternative methods.
        Parameters:
        s - the text to append to this console.
        highlight - the optional highlight color.
